name: Hotel de la Bretonnerie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in June, two adults, two kids. We stayed in a Junior suite. The room had one double bed and two twins in a connected space, not a separate room. We also had a small balcony that overlooked a courtyard. The room was at the back of the hotel, so very quiet. The room was very clean and quite charming. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The biggest pluses of this hotel are the location and price. Located in the Marais district only a few blocks from the Seine and Notre Dame. Many shops and restaurants nearby. Would stay here and again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.title: Friendly in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Location is perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 25 on 3 rd floor. Very quite and bed firm . And good size bathroom for Paris .. We were able to sleep with windows wide open.. Great as no air con!!
reviews.title: Home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Friends had huge room and bathroom .. 3rd floor room 20.. But noisy on street.. So they were not able to have windows open .. Hot!
reviews.title: Scorching and loud in summer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is not a 5 star hotel. It is a very charming guesthouse full of charm, character, and lovely people. Its everything you'd expect as an American. It is located in the heart of the Marais, but you feel like you're in a quiet corner at night. We loved wandering around the twisting narrow streets and sitting outside in the area cafes. We had a mini suite, I guess - it had a main room with a large bed with a view of the street and mini fridge, a large modern bathroom with a huge tub and a decent sized separate room with a single bed (daybed type so you could use it as a couch) with a view of the back. The furnishings look "French country antique" (I.e. old) but to my great surprise, that was a seriously comfortable bed. The lobby doubles as an internet lounge and library, which is pleasant. There is a Starbucks about 3 blocks away which had the best coffee I've had in my life and we don't even like Starbucks. I'd definitely return.
reviews.title: Excellent for what it is.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got off to a shaky start (receptionist "lost" our Paris Passes and sent us on a wild goose chase around the city only to "find" them when we returned) however we settled in and really enjoyed our stay. It is located in the heart of the Marais, within walking distance from bars and clubs, Pompideu Centre and the metro. Quintessentially Parisian in style, we would recommend the Bretonnerie to anyone seeking an authentic French experience - staff included!
reviews.title: Perfect location in Le Marais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and go out of their way to meet your needs. They can tell you where to eat, where you cn go for a Zumba class, how to catch a metro, etc. The owner takes pride in both of his hotels (also owns the Hotel Chopin).
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: We have been staying at these two hotels every year for at least the past 10 years. We will be retuning soon and of course we will be staying at the Hotel Bretonnerie!
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: Great little hotel well situated in Le Merais! Nightlife, restaurants, Metro, shopping and within easy walk to Pompidou and other sights vWonderful decor, small but comfortable room, and helpful staff. Definitely will consider for next trip.
reviews.title: Super location, characterful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here with our two teenagers on the front and back end of our France vacation. It was easy to find and not a difficult trip from the airport. The staff spoke perfect English. Our first room had two areas and seemed to previously be two rooms, as there were two bathrooms. This was room 5, I think. It was great having two bathrooms for four people! One area had a queen bed and the other had a twin with a trundle. It was a little small but comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: At the end of the trip we had a different room (17 maybe). Similar beds, but a different layout. It had a tiny balcony into a courtyard (not pretty, but cute balcony). This room only had one bath. Again, comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had no problem with noise. It is not on a major road. There are some clubs near by, but it was not loud. It is close to Notre Dame area, Isle St. Louis & the Pompidou. A bit far for the Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coeur (not direct a Metro trip). The Marais is a nice area we had not explored before. We wanted to be near Gare de Lyon, which we needed to take a taxi to.
reviews.title: Elegant, Parisian Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have a problem without AC because it was cold outside! Would probably be stuffy in the summer.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in the Marais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights after a business trip in Switzerland. Arrived from train to Gare de Lyon and took a taxi to the hotel. Reasonable cost of 13E.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in the Marais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights, and enjoyed a very spacious room for Paris, nicely decorated and comfortable, a decent breakfast for Paris, and the most convenient location, with so much within walking distance. Not cheap, but then little decent is in Paris. Very helpful and friendly staff, and free internet computer in the lobby (although a French keyboard takes a little getting used to, "q" and "a" swapped for instance.....!
reviews.title: Great convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reading other comments, I could imagine it would get hot in the summer, and noisy if you were on the front and wanted your windows open. There is one of the many gay clubs in the area just down the street, which can be noisy late at night. The Marais is a very cosmopolitan area, but we "oldies" felt quite safe walking around, and there are many wonderful restaurants and shops and attractions.
reviews.title: Bravo Bretonnerie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel which we shall use again, and thoroughly recommended.It was recommended to us by a superb nearby hotel we stayed in in June and which was full this time The reception staff here have excellent English (but try your French first, French people appreciate you making an effort).
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One tip, its very difficult to get a taxi in the little street outside the hotel, so we pre-booked one through the hotel to take us to our Rugby Club dinner on the Saturday night. What we didn't realise is the pre-booked taxis charge from when they leave their garage, so we had an extra 10 Euros to pay. Thus in total, our taxi from the hotel to Rue Faubourg St Honore cost us 24 Euros, about £22. it was half the price for a flagged down one to take us back afterwards. So when we left to come home, it was only a few minutes walk with our cases down to the major Rue de Rivoli, where a taxi was easy to come by.
reviews.title: OK for Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: A final tip - my 1959 "O" Level French is OK, but my West Country accent sometimes fools the French, so I always type out a number of slips of paper with the hotel address on to give to taxi drivers (especially as many of them don't have French as their native tongue anyway - bit like New York taxi drivers!).
reviews.title: Charming Paris Hotel

description: A few steps away from the Place des Vosges, the Picasso Museum, the Georges Pompidou Center and from the Notre-Dame, you will enjoy a charming residence typical of the Marais area, which has managed to preserve its character.Each of its 7 suites and 22 rooms, uniquely decorated, invites you to an intimate stay. It resides in an old private hotel from the 17th Century and buried in the heart of Pari, where it is easy to get lost among the old facades and flowered interior gardens.
